byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Vice Pres Joe Biden is pondering third bid at presidency in 2016, weighing his own uncertainty as he struggles to recover from his son's death against support of some Democrats and urge to create new political legacy.
lead_paragraph: In recent appearances, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. looked like a candidate but sounded like an unhappy warrior, still mourning his son and unsure of his future.

headline.main: As the Nation Watches, Joe Biden Struggles With Whether to Run for President
headline.print_headline: On National Stage, Biden Ponders One More Race

snippet: In recent appearances, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. looked like a candidate but sounded like an unhappy warrior, still mourning his son and unsure of his future.
